etymology.description: Semantic: 木(木) (mù, "tree") + Phonetic: 目(目) (mù) = eye on tree -> to look at each other -> mutual
etymology.interpretation: The character 相(xiāng, "mutual") combines 目(目) (mù, "eye") suggesting seeing or observing, with 木(木) (mù, "tree"), reflecting the idea of looking out over a distance or surveying. This is extended to mean looking at each other, thus becoming associated with mutual or reciprocal actions.

examples.chinese: 他们相互扶持(他們相互扶持)。
朋友之间要相互理解(朋友之間要相互理解)，共同进步(共同進步)。
examples.pinyin: Péngyǒu zhījiān yào xiānghù lǐjiě, gòngtóng jìnbù.
examples.english: Friends should understand each other and make progress together.

examples.chinese: 夫妻之间应相互尊重(夫妻之間應相互尊重)。
examples.english: Husbands and wives should mutually respect each other.
